list_definition.definition: a sleeping place in a ship etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We reserved a second-class berth in a shared cabin.

list_definition.definition: a place in a port etc where a ship can be moored

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The marina provided a safe berth for the boat.

list_ex_of_english: One most important factor, as we have suggested in the previous paragraph, is the possibility of providing deep water berths.
They will find that certain ports and channels need widening and berths need deepening, and in many cases mechanical appliances need modernisation.
I confirmed that 11 berths were mentioned; but that number has now been increased to 12.
We even see them getting new ships built in foreign shipyards, whilst berths in our own shipyards are empty.
There is a proviso that, in exceptional circumstances, all the available berths on any sailing should be placed at the disposal of the military authorities.
Either the berths must be used better or the labour force must be deployed to better advantage.
Only a limited number of senior civil servants are eligible for these reserved berths.
Moreover, if many additional berths were built, a shortage of skilled manpower would also be a problem.
